page.title: 06 MOTORWAY _ M40.
page.content: The section of the M40 which cuts the S.W.corner of our area,was begun in 1969.As a result Stokenchurch & Studley Green are much quieter but not much safer villages & local trade does not seem to have suffered,(a transport cafe is still full most nights.) New houses built right by the motorway suffer from its noise. Beyond Stokenchurch,where a{P.O. {telecommunications tower}boosts T.V. signals & links satellite communications between Goonhilly & London,lies Aston Rowant Nature Reserve.Local amenity groups contested the proposed route of the M40 through a cutting here.The government went ahead but the{Nature Conservancy {Council's}suggestions for the preservation of the landscape were accepted.These included sowing grass seed suited to the{chalk banks.
